original: Jephson, Carl Herman, direktör, Trantorp, Rosenholm, f. 26/8/86 i Gammalstorp, Blek. 1., av Nils J. o. Elna Andersson. G. 14 m. Hattie Nilsson. Barn: Elsa f. 15, Nils 18, Jeppe 20, Brita 23. — Brygg :utbildn. v. Inst. f. Gärungsgewerbe i Berlin 09-10, v. Alfr. Jörgensens jäsn:fysio-dog. lab. i Köpenhamn 10 o. v. Wahl-Henius Inst. of Fermentology i Chicago 12. Res. t. Tyskl., Frankr. o. Ital. 05-10, USA 10-14. Inneh. av Nättraby Brygg. o. Mineralvattenfabr. 16-27, verkst. dir. o. chef f. A-B Fören. Brygg, i Karlskrona o. Lyckeby, ordf. i sityr. f. A-B Fören. Vattenfabr. i Ronnieby 46. Led, av styr. f. Sv. Ha nid: bankens .avd :kont. i Karlskrona, Hobbies: jakt, ’fiske, bridge, RVO 43.
translated: Jephson, Carl Herman, director, Trantorp, Rosenholm, born on August 26, 1886 in Gammalstorp, Blekinge. Firstborn son of Nils J. and Elna Andersson. Married on the 14th of an undisclosed month with Hattie Nilsson. Children: Elsa born in 1915, Nils born in 1918, Jeppe born in 1920, Brita born in 1923. Undertook brewing education at the Institute for Brewing Industry in Berlin from 1909 to 1910, at Alfred Jörgensen's yeast physiology laboratory in Copenhagen in 1910, and at the Wahl-Henius Institute of Fermentology in Chicago in 1912. Traveled to Germany, France, and Italy from 1905 to 1910, and to the USA from 1910 to 1914. Became the owner of Nättraby Brewery and Mineral Water Factory from 1916 to 1927, served as managing director and leader of A-B Fören. Brygg in Karlskrona and Lyckeby, and was chairman of the board for A-B Fören. Vattenfabr. in Ronnieby in 1946. A member of the board of directors for the local branch of the Swedish Handelsbanken in Karlskrona. Hobbies include hunting, fishing, and bridge. Awarded the Royal Order of Vasa in 1943.
